_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Marathon Petroleum Company, LLC
Texas Refining Division

Risk Management Plan

Executive Summary


Commitment to the Community

Marathon Petroleum is committed to maintaining a high standard of Health, Environmental, Safety, and Security performance.  Marathon is also dedicated to being a good neighbor in our community through open, constructive dialog and input from stakeholders on issues of mutual interest.  These principles are an integral part of our vision and values.


Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

At Marathon Petroleum Company LLC's Texas Refining Division, we are committed to operating and maintaining all of our processes in a safe and responsible manner.  We use a combination of accidental release prevention programs and emergency response planning programs to help ensure the safety of our employees, contractors, and the public as well as protection of the environment.  We strive for the goal of no accidents, injuries, unsafe work practices, or unsafe conditions throughout our operations.


Regulated Substances

At Marathon Petroleum Company LLC's Texas Refining Division, we produce automotive fuels and chemical feedstocks from petroleum using a variety of processing operations.  In our processes, we handle a variety of flammable mixtures.  We also handle hydrofluoric (HF) acid, which is used as a catalyst to produce high-quality gasoline blending components.


Accidental Release Prevention Program

At Marathon Petroleum Company LLC's Texas Refining Division, we take a systematic, proactive approach to preventing accidental releases.  This approach to prevention is implemented through programs that incorporate requirements of the EPA Risk Management Plan, the OSHA Process Safety Management standard, and the American Chemistry Council Responsible Care initiative.  In addition to these programs, we have implemented chemical-specific safety features to help monitor, detect, and mitigate accidental releases such as hydrocarbon a

nd gas detectors, deinventory systems, redundant instrumentation and controls, fire suppression and extinguishing systems, and personal protective equipment.


Five-year Accident History

This facility has experienced one accident during the past five years which met the reporting criteria.  The accident involved an injury to a contractor employee that was exposed to a hydrocarbon release.


Emergency Response Program

At Marathon Petroleum Company LLC's Texas Refining Division, we have developed an integrated contingency plan which consolidates all of the various federal, state, and local regulatory requirements for emergency response planning.  Our written program provides the essential planning and training for effectively protecting workers, contractors, the public, and the environment during emergency situations.  The program consists of procedures for responding to a release of a regulated substance, including the possibility of a fire or explosion if a flammable substance is accidentally released.  The procedures address all aspects of emergency response, including proper first aid and medical treatment for exposures, refinery evacuation plans and accounting for refinery personnel after an evacuation, notification of local emergency response agencies and the public if a release occurs, and post-incident cleanup and decontamination requirements.  In addition, procedures are in place to address maintenance, inspection, and testing of emergency response equipment, as well as instructions that address the use of emergency response equipment.  The overall emergency response program for the facility is coordinated with the Texas City-LaMarque-Hitchcock Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) and with Texas City emergency management officials.


Planned Changes to Improve Safety

At Marathon Petroleum Company LLC's Texas Refining Division, we strive to improve the safety of our operations through periodic safety audits, incident investigations, process hazard anal

ysis, and the solicitation of safety suggestions from employees.  Safety improvements as a result of these activities include:

* Upgrade facility building construction to enhance protection of personnel

* Comprehensive update of all piping and instrument drawings for all units

* Install closed loop sampling systems

* Upgrade or install safety instrumented systems
